head.title: Like Old Times at Duke: No. 1 in the A.C.C. and Seeded First in Its Regional

hedline.hl1: Like Old Times at Duke: No. 1 in the A.C.C. and Seeded First in Its Regional
hedline.hl2: It's March, and Duke Believes. Opponents Beware.

abstract.p: Duke University defeats Georgia Tech University, 69-64, to win men's Atlantic Coast Conference tournament championship; other conference results noted (S)

block.p: Perhaps it is true what they say about Duke, that this is not a vintage group of blue-chip Blue Devils.
They may lack depth behind the scoring of the brilliant J.J. Redick and his sidekick at guard, Daniel Ewing, and the low-post power of center Shelden Williams.
Duke is still Duke, which won another A.C.C. tournament title. Other winners Sunday: Illinois, Florida, Okahoma State, Southeastern Louisiana and Alabama A&M.
Perhaps it is true what they say about Duke, that this is not a vintage group of blue-chip Blue Devils.
They may lack depth behind the scoring of the brilliant J.J. Redick and his sidekick at guard, Daniel Ewing, and the low-post power of center Shelden Williams.

But what is not to like about a 25-5 record and an Atlantic Coast Conference tournament championship after Sunday's 69-64 victory over Georgia Tech at the MCI Center? Duke is still Duke, a talented team many love to hate and some learn to fear.
Led by the veteran coach, Mike Krzyzewski, the Devils will open the N.C.A.A. tournament seeded No. 1 in the Austin Regional and will play Delaware State (19-13) on Friday in Charlotte.
Georgia Tech (19-11) is seeded fifth in the Albuquerque Regional and will play George Washington (22-7) on Friday in Nashville.
''You can expect a lot from us,'' Ewing said. ''We believe in ourselves. So far this year, we've just been building. We'll be a typical Duke team in the tournament.''
In the final, Redick led Duke with 26 points, Ewing had 15 before fouling out with 4:32 left, and Williams was pivotal with 16 points, 13 rebounds and 6 blocked shots.
Duke has won the tournament title in six of the last seven seasons.

Tech guard Jarrett Jack sprained his ankle with 9:41 left, but he returned to score 7 of his team-best 19 points in helping the Yellow Jackets cut a 13-point Duke lead to 2 with 1 minute 27 seconds left. The Jackets held the Devils without a field goal for more than 11 minutes at the end. Will Bynum scored 14 for Tech, but he missed all seven 3-point attempts.
Big Ten

ILLINOIS 54, WISCONSIN 43 -- The top-ranked Illini (32-1) built a big lead, then dominated defensively to hold off No. 23 Wisconsin (22-8) in the Big Ten tournament final for their team-record 32nd victory.
Illinois will play Fairleigh Dickinson (20-12) in the first round of the N.C.A.A. tournament Thursday in Indianapolis. The Badgers play Northern Iowa (21-10) in Oklahoma City on Friday. (AP)
Southeastern
FLORIDA 70, KENTUCKY 53 -- Matt Walsh had 26 points as the Gators (23-7) routed Kentucky for their first SEC tournament championship.

The loss knocked the No. 4 Wildcats out of contention for a No. 1 seed in the N.C.A.A. tournament. Kentucky (25-5) is seeded second in the Austin Regional, and will play Eastern Kentucky (22-8) in the first round Thursday in Indianapolis. Florida plays Ohio (21-10) in Nashville on Friday. (AP)
Big 12

OKLAHOMA ST. 72, TEXAS TECH 68 -- John Lucas scored 19 points, including a free throw with 4.4 seconds left, and No. 10 Oklahoma State (24-6) earned its second straight Big 12 tournament championship.

Oklahoma State will play Southeastern Louisiana (24-8), the Southland conference champion, in the first round of the N.C.A.A. tournament on Friday in Oklahoma City. Texas Tech (20-10) plays U.C.L.A. (18-10) on Thursday in Tucson. (AP)
National Invitation Tournament
40-TEAM FIELD CHOSEN -- Shunned by the N.C.A.A. tournament for the first time in 12 years, Maryland (16-12) is headed to the N.I.T.
The Terrapins play Oral Roberts (25-7) on Wednesday.
Conference USA had five teams selected, the A.C.C. and Mid-American had four, and the Colonial Athletic Association had three. The Big East, Big 12, Pac-10, SEC and America East each had two.
Eleven teams have at least 20 victories, down from 13 last year, and three have 15 victories. (AP)
COLLEGE BASKETBALL: CONFERENCE TOURNAMENT FINALS
